page.title: 06WARKWORTH HALL FARM,TWYFORD
page.content: THE FARM IS OWNED BY A BROTHER AND SISTER.THEY HAVE BEEN ON THE FARM SINCE 1925 WHEN THEIR PARENTS MOVED THERE. BROUGHT UP ON THE FARM THEY TOOK OVER WHEN THEIR FATHER DIED.AS WELL AS THE OWNERS 2 OTHER PEOPLE ALSO WORK THERE. THE 400 ACRES ARE DIVIDED INTO 20 FIELDS MEASURING BETWEEN 5 AND 45 ACRES.ROUGHLY HALF THE FARM IS USED FOR ANIMALS AND HALF FOR ARABLE.SOME FIELDS ARE KEPT FOR PERMANENT PASTURE SOME FOR CROP ROTATION. THEY HAVE 148 BREEDING EWES WHICH PRODUCE BETWEEN 250 AND 350 LAMBS FOR MARKET,WHICH MEANS THEY HAVE 400 TO 500 SHEEP IN THE SPRING.THE EWES ARE SHAWN BY AN OUTSIDE FIRM BUT THE MONEY FOR THE WOOL IS PAID TO THE OWNERS. CALVES BOUGHT AT BANBURY MARKET ARE FATTENED UP AND SOLD FOR BEEF.THIS YEAR THEY HAD 84 CALVES.COWS AND SHEEP GRAZE TOGETHER IN THE FIELDS.
